week3.practice1_html:

week3.practice2_html:
What it is

The Popeye Protocol helps you quietly rebuild your iron stores through smart daily food choices â€” without relying on heavy supplements. Itâ€™s about pairing the right iron-rich foods with nutrients that help your body actually absorb them, so every meal supports stronger strands from the inside out.

Why this practice matters for you now

Sommer, your shedding has begun to steady, but recovery is still competing with the hormonal shifts and stress load of perimenopause. Low iron adds silent strain just as your follicles try to thicken up again. Right now â€” in your stabilization phase â€” fueling with absorbable iron is the big domino that helps your new baby hairs mature into resilient strands over the next few months.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Add one rich source daily. Pick from grass-fed beef, lentils, spinach, or tofu. Aim for at least one â€œiron anchorâ€ meal per day.
  2. Pair with vitamin C. Add citrus, peppers, or berries to the same meal â€” it can double your iron uptake.
  3. Time your blockers wisely. Coffee, tea, and high-fiber bran can reduce absorption, so keep them at least 1â€“2 hours away from iron meals.
  4. Lean on cast-iron cookware. Cooking acidic foods like tomato sauce in cast iron can sneak small amounts of extra iron into your diet effortlessly.
  5. Track your energy and appetite. Better iron use often shows first as steadier energy and fewer cravings before obvious hair gains appear.

What to look for

  • Early wins: Warm hands and feet returning, better morning energy, and reduced dizziness within 2 weeks mean your intake is working.
  • Watch-outs: Restrictive eating can block progress â€” if stress tempts you to skip or shrink meals, prep your iron anchor food ahead of time so itâ€™s effortless to grab.

week3.practice3_html:
